messageBody:

sites?

Thanks!

Qionghua Yang

>From: Robert Leftwich <digital@...>
>Reply-To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [junit] Servlet testing...
>Date: Wed, 11 Jul 2001 12:51:09 +1000
>
>At 12:05 PM 11/07/2001, Charlie Woloszynski wrote:
> >Anyone had any experience with Cactus (from apache.org) for servlet
>testing?
>
>I've just started implementing some unit tests using Cactus and I like it.
>It does take a little time to get your head around the architecture, as
>some parts of your unit test code are run on the client, some on the server
>but once over that hurdle it is a 'good thing', particularly for those
>areas of your code that cannot be tested outside a servlet environment.
>
>However, one of my projects is using Enhydra and I could not get Cactus to
>cooperate nicely with Enhydra presentation objects as it uses a lot of
>non-standard servlet infrastructure that gets in the way, so I switched to
>using the mock object approach (using EasyMock
>http://tammofreese.de/easymock/index.html) and found using it a breeze.
>There is an interesting discussion on the relative merits of mock objects
>vs Cactus on the Cactus web site. My personal opinion is that it is a
>matter of choosing the right tool for the task at hand, sometimes mock
>objects will be better, other times Cactus should get the nod (particularly
>for testing against multiple app servers in a running environment - which
>is more functional testing than unit testing anyway).
>
>Robert
>
